channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold is going up because Trump is talking down the dollar, feeding ‘the narrative of relative U.S. decline,’ UBS fears
item.description: The dollar hasn’t been this weak for years.

item.title: Despite Popular Trends, Neuroscience Says You Don’t Really Need to Be Bored More Often
item.description: The idea that we need more boredom in our overstimulated lives is popular right now. One neuroscientist is calling B.S. on it.

item.title: 9 startups from Palantir alumni you need to know
item.description: Last week, I published a deep exploration into Palantir and its founder factory and how the company’s power and success can be explained by its abilit...

item.title: Oxford’s giant new lab building has a secret hidden in its facade
item.description: As researchers approach the front doors of Oxford ’s new Life and Mind Building (LaMB), they’re greeted with a towering concrete facade, rendered with...

item.title: SAP boss Christian Klein has seen the AI future. What you say will be more important than what you type
item.description: Christian Klein, CEO of SAP predicts the end of the keyboard as we enter the era of Applied AI and voice commands.

item.title: ‘Don’t worry, I’ve got you’: 3 artists channel the outrage of Minneapolis
item.description: Artist Edel Rodriguez published his new print, Minneapolis , just hours after a federal agent shot and killed ICU nurse Alex Pretti on January 24. The...

item.title: What if hope is a strategy?
item.description: A new book by a former Deloitte executive turned workplace well-being expert argues exactly that In her new book Hope Is the Strategy , Jen Fisher, an...

item.title: This millennial quit her corporate 9-to-5 to pet sit—she’s now living rent-free, saving thousands a month, while earning $70 per day
item.description: Thanks to pet sitting, 32-year-old Georgina Welsh travels the world, works half the hours, and still takes home as much as she did in her corporate jo...

item.title: Want to Live Longer? Science Says Sleep ‘Regularity’ Is More Impactful Than Sleep Duration
item.description: How many hours of sleep you get certainly matters, but research shows when you get those hours matters even more.

item.title: It Turns Out, AI Agents Can’t Replace Experienced Humans
item.description: Not now, and I’m willing to bet not ever. Here’s why.

item.title: This is what happens when failure leads to a promotion
item.description: Kim (not her real name) is a scientist and tenured faculty member at a high-profile university. For years, she steadily moved up the hierarchy, yet no...

item.title: American Airlines Just Revealed Some Surprising Numbers, and I Have to Ask This 3-Word Question
item.description: The leadership lesson here goes beyond airlines.

item.title: 4 of the Best Industries for Starting a Business in 2026
item.description: Startups in these niche industries have significant tailwinds and growth potential.

item.title: As vet bills jump 40% in recent years, startup Snout raises $110 million for its ‘membership’ model to defray costs
item.description: Costs vary based on plan, but on average customers are paying $65 a month for Snout to help take care of vet costs upfront.

item.title: CEO of Glassdoor and Indeed parent says AI is not replacing workers: ‘We’re not seeing that kind of data at all’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.
